comment._content: I'm pretty sure this the corner of Hay Street and William Street, not Flag St.

comment.author: 92558352@N05
comment._content:
definitely hay and william.
maybe it used to be known as flag street?

comment.author: 92585785@N03
comment._content: If read from old style handwriting, H could look like Fl and y look like g?

comment.author: 92584555@N07
comment._content: Wesley Church, Hay St to Perth Town Hall. catalogue.slwa.wa.gov.au/record=b2111873~S6#.UQNkfbZGh10

comment.author: 32945250@N08
comment._content: the flag was first raised near to what is now the corner of hay and barrack st, maybe that is where the name originated, later to become Howick St and then hay St in the 1890s. Wesley Church in photo - corner of hay and william st, looking East to the Town hall

comment.author: 31575009@N05
comment._content: I have updated the description for this image and the others on Hay Street. Many thanks for your comments and feedback.
